text: These are people who certainly have not proved that they are worthy of the trust that we repose in them. As far as this job is concerned, let me also indicate that when it comes to BECE, most of the decisions are taken by the Ghana Education Service. For example, the selection of supervisors and invigilators is done by the district exams officer, he explained. His comments come in the wake of a JoyNews Hotline investigation led by GH Probe’s Francisca Enchil, which uncovered disturbing levels of collusion at examination centres.
translated: [Abantu abanenkinga abangaweli kuphetha ukuthi bafanele ukunikezwa ukwethembeka esikweni. Ngokwesikhathi esiyikhona, ngiyabona ukuthi uma kuzwa kwa- BECE, amaqiniso amaningi angenwa nguGhana Education Service. Kwa mfano, ukhetho kwabohlisi nezikhulu zesikhala kwenziwa yinduna yezinga lolimi, wachaza. Izinkulumo zakhe zivela emva kokuthuthukisa kwezwi lokuqonda kwa- JoyNews Hotline olawulwa ngu- Francisca Enchil wesi- GH Probe, olwaphothula amaqiniso amaningi angenwa ukuxhumana kwezikhala zesikhala.]

text: A variety of socioeconomic and cultural factors were identified as major barriers to accessing and utilizing MHCS. Over half of the women surveyed cited poverty, illiteracy, restrictions from their husbands, the distance to health facilities, and long queues as reasons for not using services. Additionally, over a third of the women pointed to cultural practices within their communities as a cause for delays in seeking care. These findings reveal that addressing maternal health in this region requires more than just improving clinical services; it also means tackling deeply rooted societal and personal challenges that women face daily.
translated: [Inombolo yezwi ezahlukene zesosho-ekonomiki nezokwethembeka kwabantu zaziwa njengemithombo mikulu yokwephula ukufika kanye nokusebenzisa i-MHCS. Kakhulu kwabesifazane abasungulwa baphethe ukuphila kancinci, ukungasebenzi, ukuxhaswa kwabo ngabafowethu, isibalo sokufika kuzikhungo zokwelapha, kanye nezwi ezikhulu njengamagunya okungasebenzisa izwi. Ngaphezu kwalokho, kakhulu kwabesifazane abaphethe izindlela zokwethembeka kwabantu ezikhona kuzo kwenyezindawo zabo njengesababu yokukhubazeka kwabo ukuthola usizo. Izimvunulo zibonisa ukuthi ukushaya imithetho yempilo yabesifazane kulesifundazwe kudinga ukuthi zingaphandle kwenzeke ukuthuthukisa izwi zokwelapha; kudala kufanele kwenzeke ukuthatha izidingo text: Despite his shortcomings, Unoka was a talented musician. He was a tall but very thin man with a slight stoop and a mournful look, which would disappear when he was drinking or playing his flute. His happiest moments came in the months after the harvest, when the village musicians would retrieve their instruments from above the fireplace. Unoka would join them, his face filled with pure joy and peace. Sometimes, other villages would invite Unoka and his band to teach them their tunes, and they would stay for several months, sharing their music.
translated: [Ngikhona kwezinga lakhe, Unoka wayengumculi othandekayo. Wayengumuntu omdala kodwa omfushane kakhulu onemvuso omncinci kanye nemvuso ophethwe, ofuna ukuphela uma ekhuluma noma ehlabe igxube. Imizuzu yami yabaleka kwaminyaka emva kwekuletha, uma abaculi basekhaya bazohlamba izikhali zabo phezulu kwesithathi. Unoka wayozihlangana, isikhala sakhe sifushane ngenyanga yobuhle kanye nengqondo. Kwezinye izikhathi, amakhaya amanye azothatha Unoka kanye neband yakhe ukuzithatha amagugu, bazohlala imizuzu eminingi, bazishaya imculo.]

text: At the Derby Avenue RC Basic School and St. George’s Anglican Basic School in Accra, invigilators were captured openly demanding GH¢60 daily tokens, supervisors pocketed envelopes of GH¢400, and candidates were asked to contribute to an Aseda Offertory. John Kapi stressed that once WAEC provides feedback on such incidents, it is the responsibility of the Ghana Education Service (GES) to take decisive action. And so when these issues come up, once the feedback goes to them, we [WAEC] expect that they would react appropriately and ensure that the right action is taken against the people, he said.
translated: [Ekusikoleni i-Derby Avenue RC Basic School na i-St. George’s Anglican Basic School e-Accra, abaphathi bebhokisi bephothule ngokulingana bezama izitokheni zikahora zama-randi ase-GH¢60, abaphathi bebhokisi bephothule izimpahla zama-randi ase-GH¢400, kanti abafundi babulawa ukuthi bazamelele e-Aseda Offertory. John Kapi wemphela ukuthi uma u-WAEC esiphakamisa ukubika kulezi zingqinamba, inemilo yokuthatha izinyathelo ezinkulu i-Ghana Education Service (GES). Kanti uma lezi zingqinamba zibuka, uma ukubika kuye kuthiwa, sithi [WAEC] sizwa ukuthi bazokwenza ngokulingana nezwi zabo, bese benza isenzo esingunaphakade kulezi zingqinamba, wathi.]

text: For rural communities in Ghana, especially in the Kumbungu district, access to and use of maternal healthcare services (MHCS) remain a significant challenge. This study set out to explore the specific barriers preventing women from utilizing these services and to evaluate the quality of care provided. The research adopted a mixed-methods approach, combining both quantitative and qualitative data to get a comprehensive view of the situation. This phased design involved surveying 441 pregnant and postpartum women and conducting interviews with 20 healthcare providers. A facility checklist was also used to assess the state of clinics, including the availability of essential drugs and equipment.
translated: [Ekupheleni kwabakhaya eGhana, ikakhulukazi eKumbungu, ukufinyelela kwezempilo zezalwa (MHCS) kudala ukhathazekile. Ucwaningo lwenze ukuthola izinkinga ezikhona ezizivimbela abesifazane ukwenza kakhulu nezempilo zezalwa kanye nokulingana nezempilo zokwelapha. Ucwaningo lwenzelwe ngendlela ephambili, ikhombisa izinhlobo zezempilo zezalwa zezokwelapha kanye nezempilo zezalwa zezokwelapha. Lendlela yokuqala yalwiswa kwenze ukulingana nezempilo zezalwa zezokwelapha kanye nezempilo zezalwa zezokwelapha. I-checklist yasezikhungweni yasebenzwa ukulingana nezempilo zezalwa zezokwelapha kanye nezempilo zezalwa zezokwelapha.]

text: Okonkwo was a man of great renown throughout his nine villages and even beyond, a fame built entirely on his own remarkable achievements. At just eighteen years old, he brought honor to his village by defeating Amalinze the Cat, a legendary wrestler who had been undefeated for seven years. Amalinze earned his nickname because his back never once touched the earth. The old men of the village considered Okonkwo's victory one of the fiercest fights they had ever seen.

text: Muntaka assured the committee of full logistical and secretariat support from the Ministry and urged them to partner with civil society organizations, development partners, and faith-based institutions in carrying out their work. He described the task as heavy but honorable, stressing that the people of Gbenyiri and surrounding communities were looking up to the committee as instruments of peace, reconciliation, and healing.
translated: [U-Muntaka ushade isikomiti ukuthi uMnyango uzokwenza ukusekela kwezokuxhumana kanye nezokusekela kwezikhulu, wababiza ukuthi bazihlangane nezinhlangano zomphakathi, abaphathi kwezokuthuthukisa, kanye nezikhulu zezinkolo ukwenza umsebenzi wabo. Ubekezele ukuthi umsebenzi wabo ungumsebenzi omkhulu kodwa wokuhlonipha, ekhuluma ukuthi abantu baseGbenyiri kanye nezindawo ezizungezile zibheke isikomiti njengemikhonto yoxolo, ukwemukela, kanye nezwi lolondoloza.]

text: The study also shed light on significant facility-based challenges that compromise the quality of care. A key issue was the inadequate number of midwives, which likely contributes to the long queues women reported. Additionally, the absence of essential equipment and drugs was a major problem. For example, health service providers specifically recommended a greater number of trained midwives and the provision of critical logistics like ultrasound machines and proper delivery equipment to ensure effective and high-quality care.
translated: [Isifundo sasiphinde sikhombise imikhawulo emikhulu eminingi yezinhlalo zokuhlola ezihlanganisa ubuhlakani bokuhlola. Inhlangano enkulu yileyo kwakunguqulo lwabafundisi abaningi, lokho kungenzela ukuthi kunezikhala ezide ezibikwa abesifazane. Ngaphezu kwalokho, ukungabi kwemigomo eminingi yezikhokelo nezidakamizwa kwakungumkhawulo omkhulu. text: Okonkwo was an imposing figure, tall and massive with a severe expression, a result of his bushy eyebrows and wide nose. His breathing was so heavy that his family could hear it from their own houses when he slept. When he walked, his heels barely touched the ground, making him seem poised to pounce on someone—which he often did. He had a slight stammer, and in moments of anger, he would resort to his fists when words failed him. He had no patience for men who were not successful, and this sentiment stemmed from his deep-seated shame for his own father.
translated: [Okonkwo wayengumuntu omdala, owaye ngokubukeka kancinci, owaye nompheme wakhe omkhulu, wawenza umpheme wakhe uhlasele, ngokwesikhala kwemikhala yakhe emnyama kancinci nezwi lakhe elikhulu. Ukuphumula kwakhe kwakungena kancinci ukuthi umndeni wakhe wawumthola ngaphandle kwemizi yabo wakhe eshaya. Ngokuhamba, amaphephu akhe angakhohlwa ukuthi azungeze phezulu, wawenza ukuthi angena ngokuthatha ngempela—ngokwesikhala kwakhe. Wayenehlahla encinci, kanti ngesikhathi sokuthatha, wayekhetha amagunya wakhe ngokwesikhala kwamagama wakhe. Wayenayo imvamisa kubantu abangena bafikile, kanti lokhu kwakungena ngokwesikhala kwesifo sakhe somndeni wakhe.]

text: The West African Examinations Council (WAEC) says officials implicated in acts of corruption during the Basic Education Certificate Examination (BECE) will be blacklisted from ever taking part in its activities again. Speaking on JoyNews’ PM Express on September 8, WAEC’s Director of Public Affairs, John Kapi, said the Council cannot continue to work with individuals who have betrayed the trust placed in them during national examinations.

text: The study found that while a high percentage of women did engage with some maternal health services—87.5% attended antenatal care (ANC), 87.3% had a skilled delivery, and 84.8% had a postnatal care (PNC) visit—the frequency of care was a concern. A little over half of the participants (53.4%) had the recommended four or more ANC visits, and nearly half (46.9%) didn't register until their second trimester. These figures highlight a gap between initial access and consistent, timely utilization of services, suggesting that women may be facing obstacles that prevent them from fully engaging with the healthcare system throughout their pregnancies.
translated: [Isifundo sathola ukuthi noma izinkinga eziningi zezintombi zingena kancinci nezinsizakalo zempilo yezintombi—87.5% zidlala iziviso zezingane zesikhathi (ANC), 87.3% zizalwa ngabantu abaqeqeshwe, kanti 84.8% zidlala iziviso zesikhathi zokuzalwa (PNC) —ukulingana kwesikhathi kwesizo kungenxa. Izinkulumo ezingaphezulu kancinci (53.4%) zidlala iziviso zingaphezulu kancinci zokuzalwa zesikhathi (ANC), kanti eziningi (46.9%) zingakwazi ukurejista kancinci kwesikhathi zokuzalwa. Izilinganiso zibonisa ingxenye phakathi kwenkulondoloza kwesikhathi kancinci kwezinsizakalo, kunciphisa ukuthi izintombi zingena kancinci zingathinta izinkinga ezingazibophelela ukuthi zingena kancinci nezinsizakalo zempilo zonke zikhathi zokuzalwa.]

text: The crowd held its breath as the drums beat and the flutes sang. Amalinze was a clever opponent, but Okonkwo was just as skilled, and as slippery as a fish in water. Both men were incredibly strong, their muscles and nerves straining to the point of almost breaking. But in the end, Okonkwo emerged victorious. This monumental win was just the beginning of his legacy. Over the next twenty years, his fame spread like a wildfire, fueled by his unwavering resolve and personal triumphs.
translated: [Umvangeli wawephula isitha njengoba izigubhu zithi zingoma nezifulela zithi zingoma. Amalinze kwakungumdlali ophethe umthetho, kodwa Okonkwo kwakungena ngcono, kanti kwakungena njengesihlahla esiluhlaza esinamandla. Abafana bawo bobabili bawungena ngcono, amaseli wawo kanye nezwi zingena ngcono, zingena ngcono kwaze kwaba zingena ngcono. Kodwa ekugcineni, Okonkwo waphumelela. Lo mngcwabo wakhe kwakungena ngcono, kwakungena ngcono kwaze kwaba kwakungena ngcono. Ngeminyaka eyishumi nane ezayo, igama lakhe laphumelela njengomlilo, olwakhe olwakhe ngokwethembeka kwakhe kanye nezwi zingena ngcono.]

text: The seven-member mediation committee will be chaired by Mr. Emmanuel Habuka Bombande. Other members of the committee include Alhaji Collins Dauda (MP and chair of the Committee on Lands and Natural Resource in Parliament), Rev. Father Lazarus Annyere (Chair of Savannah Regional Peace Council), Dr. Festus Aubyn (West Africa Network for Peace-building), Sylvia Hormane Noagbesenu Esq (Ag. Director of Women, Youth, Peace and Security Institute, Kofi Annan International Peacekeeping Training Center), Prof. Ramatu Alhassan and Dr. George Amoh (Ex. Sec. NPC) who will be the secretary.
translated: [Umvikeli wekomidi yezingane ezisikhombisa izikhulu ezi-7 uzoba ngumongameli uMnu. Emmanuel Habuka Bombande. Abanye abaphathi bokomidi bazofaka Alhaji Collins Dauda (MP noMongameli weKomidi yeMihlaba neMvelo ePhalamende), Rev. Baba Lazarus Annyere (Mongameli weSavannah Regional Peace Council), Dr. Festus Aubyn (West Africa Network for Peace-building), Sylvia Hormane Noagbesenu Esq (Ag. Director of Women, Youth, Peace and Security Institute, Kofi Annan International Peacekeeping Training Center), Prof. Ramatu Alhassan na Dr. George Amoh (Ex. Sec. NPC) ozoba ngumbhali.]

text: To improve maternal health in the Kumbungu district, both study participants and service providers offered actionable recommendations. Women suggested focusing on public education about maternal care, enforcing free MHCS, and improving the local road network to make facilities more accessible. Providers emphasized the need for more midwives and better equipment. The study concludes that both governmental and non-governmental organizations must increase investment in maternal health and address the broader socioeconomic issues affecting women. This comprehensive approach, tackling both healthcare system deficiencies and community-level barriers, is essential for truly improving maternal health outcomes.
translated: [Izindlela zokwelapheka kwabesifazane kwiSithili ya Kumbungu zingekhulunywa ngokwezwi ngokuthatha isikhala abaphenyo kanye nabaphathi bezempilo. Abesifazane bafanele ukuthi kwenzeke ukhuluma kakhulu ngempilo yabesifazane, kwenzeke ukwethenjwa kwempilo yabesifazane ukhululeke, kanye nokuthuthukisa izindlela zokuthutha zokwazi ukuthi izikhungo zingekhona ngokulingana. Abaphathi bezempilo bafanele ukuthi kwenzeke ukuthuthukisa ukuthuthukisa kwabesifazane abaphathi bezempilo kanye nokuthuthukisa izikhali zokuthutha. Ucwaningo luthi ukuthi amaqembu amakhulu kanye namakhulu angaphandle kwezwe lapho kwenzeke ukuthuthukisa ukuthutha kwempilo yabesifazane kanye nokuthutha izinkinga ezikhulu zokwelapheka kwabesifazane. Indlela ephakathi, yokuthutha izinkinga zokwelapheka kwempilo yabesifazane kanye nokuthutha izinkinga zokwelapheka kwabesifazane, inezwi kakhulu ukuthutha ukuthutha kwempilo yabesifazane.]

text: Unoka, Okonkwo's father, had passed away ten years prior. He was a man known for his laziness and carelessness, living only for the present with no thought for the future. Any money he managed to acquire—which was a rare occurrence—he would immediately spend on palm-wine, gathering his neighbors for a celebration. He believed that to see a dead man's mouth was to see the foolishness of not eating what you had in life. Unoka was also deeply in debt, owing money to nearly every one of his neighbors.
translated: [Unoka, ubaba kaOkonkwo, ushone iminyaka emihlanu edlule. Wayengumuntu owaziwa ngokuthatha isikhathi sakhe kancinci kancinci, akhuluma kuphela ngokwesikhathi esiphuthumayo, asikwazi ukuthatha isikhathi esizayo. Imali engenayo—ngoba kwakungesinye—yena wayiyakhokhela kancinci kancinci ngempahla, ekhuluma abantu bakhe bokuhlala ngempahla. Wayethemba ukuthi ukubona umlomo womuntu oshone kungukuthi ukubona ukungena kwekungadli ukudla okwakho emhlabeni. Unoka wayengenayo ingxenye kancinci kancinci, owezwa imali kubantu bakhe bonke.]
